text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: Do they eat you too much She looked at Jack for a moment in silence while his eyes were dancing with joy over the wonderful things that would make her happy again if she could only speak to him as well as he could
[Teacher]: speak to her.  He had to make a decision quickly and he chose to sit down on the couch next to her and put his hand on her knee. "I will be patient," he said with a calmness that surprised her.  "I will find a way to help you speak again if it's the last thing I do." She looked up at him with tears streaming down her face and he could feel her heartbeat slowing down in her chest.  "Thank you," she whispered softly
[Student]: to herself as she thought of all the new adventures she was likely to meet before she reached home from school or college in the fall evenings when no one knew how great everything was worth having
[Teacher]: .  "You can't imagine how I wish I could say all that to you right now," she was thinking of how she had to go to the school that was two blocks away from her house and walk in the rain that was pouring down to get there on a day that she had never felt so down in her life.  "But I am glad I can still be with you," she said softly to herself as she smiled at him.  "It's all right," he said softly
[Student]: but firmly enough not to wake up yet that night to see the shining flood of happiness outside in the distance
[Teacher]: from her eyes as she rested her head on his shoulder and closed her eyes.  "I think we can find a way to get to the end of this road together," he said and leaned over her to kiss her forehead.  "Don't worry, I'll make sure that you're the one who gets to be first to find out how everything is going to be." As we walked out of the room I couldn't help but overhear their conversation. I had to listen for a few
[Student]: minutes longer because my brain was getting warmer and there seemed little chance of escape from being able to come back to me in order to learn more about myself than from other people listening to the sound of my footsteps saying something which made me want to run away without seeing her or hearing anything more about Jack Penny and that was just beyond reach of human nature altogether Then suddenly I remembered that they used to take care of each other whenever they wanted to be togethereven though my hair was wet as

I was so sorry for my silence as we walked together in the rain without saying anything to each other but I was happy to be in his arms as we walked to the school that was two blocks away from my house.  I was happy to be with him and happy to be alive

I thought of all the good times we had.  The sound of the rain hitting the roof made me think of how I used to feel when we would sit together on the porch and listen to the rain.  I was so sorry for my silence as we walked together in the rain without saying anything to each other but I was happy to be in his arms as we walked to the school that was two blocks away from my house.  I was happy to be with him and happy to be alive

text:

I was devastated.  I wanted to be a famous painter one day and hear my mother say "that's beautiful."  But then I realized that beauty is not just about what we see on a canvas but about the emotions and feelings we can convey.  So I started to paint with

I was so proud and happy that I told my mother about it and she said "that's nice."
